summary: To encourage companies to maintain and expand operations in the United States, the Foreign-Trade Zones program offers a range of benefits, such as the possible reduction or elimination of customs duties on certain imported goods. A government board evaluates applications for establishing these zones as well as requests to reduce or eliminate specific duties and fees. We found the board followed its procedures—such as considering...
title: Foreign-Trade Zones: Board Should Document Consideration of All Required Criteria When Evaluating Applications
